Transform Response Variable for Beta Regression

Source: R/y_transformation_betareg.R
y_transformation_betareg.Rd

This function transforms a response variable \( y \) for use in beta regression by scaling it to fit the range required by beta regression models. The transformation is performed as follows:

y_transformation_betareg(y)

Arguments

y

A numeric vector of response values that are to be transformed. The vector can contain NA values which will be ignored in the calculation of the transformation.

Value

A numeric vector of the same length as y, containing the transformed response values. Values are scaled to the range (0, 1), suitable for beta regression.

Details

$$y' = \frac{y \cdot (n - 1) + 0.5}{n}$$

where \( n \) is the number of non-missing observations in \( y \).

Examples

# Example usage
y <- c(0.1, 0.5, NA, 0.3, 0.9)
transformed_y <- y.transf.betareg(y)
#> Error in y.transf.betareg(y): could not find function "y.transf.betareg"
print(transformed_y)
#> Error: object 'transformed_y' not found
